wikipedia_page.main: William Whiteman Carlton Topley FRS (19 January 1886 – 21 January 1944) was a British bacteriologist.  He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1930. He gave the Goulstonian Lectures in 1919 and the Milroy Lectures in 1926. Awarded the Royal Medal in 1942.

response: * William Whiteman Carlton Topley (1886–1944), British bacteriologist
